Pedestal for Books:
Sermons Solina agitated the minds of his subjects, and the Emperor considered it dangerous to the existence of the state. Soon Elmoreden royal guards were ordered to find Solina and take her into custody along with her ​​students. Monastic army led by Anais and other warriors from among the followers of Solina fought bravely, but were defeated. Solina imperial troops surrendered on the condition that they are untouched by its followers.
The trial lasted exactly one week. Solina was accused of treason and sentenced to death. The execution took place the next day in the presence of Emperor Frintezza a large gathering of people.
